MetaData.MetaDataItem:
FEATURES:
- Z-Wave on/off control of up to 5 electrical devices - On/off (charging/charged) reports from USB ports to the hub (no Z-Wave control) - turn off the charging device for best results - Energy monitoring for each of the 5 outlets - Built-in overload protection and ETL certification - Z-Wave Plus signal repeater to extend network range - S2 security protocol and the latest 500 Z-Wave chip for faster and safer wireless communication
SPECS: - Model Number: ZEN20 VER. 2.0 - Z-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz - Power: 120 VAC - Maximum Load: 15 A total (between 5 outlets) - Maximum Load for USB ports: 2.1 A total (between 2 ports) - Cord Length: 2 feet - Range: Up to 100 feet line of sight - Installation and Use: Indoor only

1. Bring the strip within direct range of your Z-Wave gateway (hub). 2. Put the Z-Wave hub into exclusion mode. 3. Press and release the CH1 button 3 times quickly. 4. Your hub will confirm exclusion and all of the channels (child outlets) and the main device will disappear from your controller's device list.

If your primary controller is missing or inoperable, you may need to reset the device to factory settings. To complete the reset process manually, click-click-click’n’hold CH1 button for at least 10 seconds. All LED indicators will flash to confirm successful reset. NOTE: All previously recorded activity and custom settings EXCEPT for the kWh record will be erased from the device’s memory.

1. Plug the Power Strip into a grounded receptacle you’re planning to use it at (it doesn’t need to be close to the hub) 2. Initiate inclusion (pairing) in the app (or web interface). 3. CLICK CH1 BUTTON 3 TIMES QUICKLY. All LED indicators will start flashing 4. You will see 7 or 8 new on/off devices in your app: 5 channels or on/off control, 2 channels for on/off monitoring (USB ports reporting charging/ charged status, no control), and possibly one master node to access and adjust advanced settings in.

ChangeLog.Entry: Initial Metadata Import from Z-Wave Alliance Database - https://products.z-wavealliance.org/products/3158/xml

Value.label: On/Off Status Recovery After Power Failure
Value.Help: Status after Power Failure

Value.label: Power Wattage Report Value Threshold
Value.Help: 0 = power meter disabled; 1-65535 = value in watts for report threshold

Value.label: Power Wattage Report Frequency
Value.Help: 0 = disabled; 30-2678400 = time in seconds to send power wattage report

Value.label: Energy (kWh) Report Frequency
Value.Help: 0 = disabled; 30-2678400 = time in seconds to send energy report

Value.label: Overload Protection
Value.Help: 0 = disabled; 1-1800 = value in watts for overload protection

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH1
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH1

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH1
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH1, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH1
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH1

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH1
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH1, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH2
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH2

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH2
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH2, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH2
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH2

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH2
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH2, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH3
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH3

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH3
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH3, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH3
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH3

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH3
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH3, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH4
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH4

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH4
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH4, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH4
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH4

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH4
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH4, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH5
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH5

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH5
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-off timer for CH5, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH5
Value.Help: Enable or Disable auto turn-off timer for CH5

Value.label: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH5
Value.Help: Value in minutes for auto-on timer for CH5, if enabled

Value.label: Enable/Disable Manual Control
Value.Help: Enable or Disable Manual Controll for out Outlets

Value.label: LED Indicator Mode
Value.Help: Normal = LED indicator is on when power is on, off when power is off. Inverse = LED indicator is off when power is on, and on when power is off. Always Off = LED indicator is always off, regardless of power status.

Value.label: Enable/Disable Energy Monitoring Reports
Value.Help: Disable or enable energy monitoring for the entire devie. None of the outlets will send any power or energy related reports back to the hub if energy monitoring is disabled. Use this optoin to minimize the amount or reports you want to receive from the Power Strip. (Firmware > 2.0.3)

Value.label: Enable/Disable Energy Monitoring Reports for CH1
Value.Help: Disable or enabled energy monitoring for CH1. (Firmware > 2.03)

Value.label: Enable/Disable Energy Monitoring Reports for CH2
Value.Help: Disable or enabled energy monitoring for CH2. (Firmware > 2.03)

Value.label: Enable/Disable Energy Monitoring Reports for CH3
Value.Help: Disable or enabled energy monitoring for CH3. (Firmware > 2.03)

Value.label: Enable/Disable Energy Monitoring Reports for CH4
Value.Help: Disable or enabled energy monitoring for CH4. (Firmware > 2.03)

Value.label: Enable/Disable Energy Monitoring Reports for CH5
Value.Help: Disable or enabled energy monitoring for CH5. (Firmware > 2.03)

Value.label: Enable/Disable USB Reports
Value.Help: Disable or enable on/off reports send from the USB ports when a connected device is charging (drawing power) or not charging (not drawing power). (Firmware > 2.03)

Value.label: Electrical Current (A) Report Frequency
Value.Help: 0 = disabled; 30-2678400 = time in seconds to send current (A) report (Firmware > 2.03)

Value.label: Voltage (V) Report Frequency
Value.Help: 0 = disabled; 30-2678400 = time in seconds to send voltage (v) report (Firmware > 2.03)
